binary_file_format.name: SEG-Y file
binary_file_format.comment: Refer to "Digital Tape Standards" from the Society of Exploration Geophysicists

for.name: EBCDIC_header_line
for.comment: 40 lines of text each of 80 EBCDIC characters

struct.name: BINARY_header
struct.comment: 400 bytes of binary values which describe s what is in the rest of the file (ie the traces). The values are 16 or 32 bit big-endian numbers.

data.name: JobId
data.comment: Job Identification Number

data.name: LineNo
data.comment: Line Number

data.name: ReelNo
data.comment: Reel Number

data.name: NumTraces
data.comment: Number of data traces per record

data.name: NumAuxTraces
data.comment: Number of auxiliary traces per record

data.name: SampRate
data.comment: Sample interval in microseconds (for this data)

data.name: SampRateOrig
data.comment: Sample interval (for original field recording)

data.name: NumSamp
data.comment: Number of samples per trace (this data)

data.name: NumSampOrig
data.comment: Number of samples per trace (original field data)

data.name: FormatCode
data.comment: Sample format code 1 = IBM float (4 bytes), 2 = big-endian integer (4 bytes), 3 = big-endian integer (2 bytes), 4 = special int+gain format (4 bytes)

data.name: CDPFold
data.comment: Expected number of data traces per CDP ensemble.

data.name: SortCode
data.comment: 1 = as rcorded (no sorting), 2 = CDP ensemble, 3 = single fold continuous profile, 4 = horizontally stacked

data.name: SumCode
data.comment: Vertical sum code. 1 = no sum, 2 = 2 sum, ... N = N sum

data.name: SweepStart
data.comment: Sweep frequency at start

data.name: SweepEnd
data.comment: Sweep frequency at end

data.name: SweepLen
data.comment: Sweep length

data.name: SweepType
data.comment: Sweep type code: 1 = linear, 2 = parabolic, 3 = exponential, 4 = other

data.name: TraceNum
data.comment: Trace number of sweep channel

data.name: SweepStartTaper
data.comment: Sweep trace taper length at start if tapered

data.name: SweepEndTaper
data.comment: Sweep trace taper length at end if tapered

data.name: TaperType
data.comment: 1 = linear, 2 = cos squared, 3 = other

data.name: CorrCode
data.comment: Correlated data traces 1 = no, 2 = yes

data.name: BinaryGain
data.comment: Binary gain recovered 1 = yes, 2 = no

data.name: AmplitudeCode
data.comment: Amplitude recovery method: 1 = none, 2 = spherical divergence, 3 = AGC, 4 = other

data.name: UnitsCode
data.comment: Measurement system: 1 = meters, 2 = feet

data.name: ImpulseCode
data.comment: Impulse signal polarity: 1 = increase in pressure or upward geophone case movement gives negative number on tape, 2 = increase in pressure or upward geophone case movement gives positive number on tape

data.name: VibeCode
data.comment: Vibratory polarity code.

data.name: Unassigned
data.comment: For optional information

data.name: TraceNum
data.comment: Trace sequence number within the line

data.name: TraceNumReel
data.comment: Trace sequence number within this reel

data.name: FFID
data.comment: Original field record number

data.name: TraceNumOrig
data.comment: Trace number within the original field record

data.name: TraceId
data.comment: Trace identification code

data.name: CoordX
data.comment: Source coordinate X

data.name: CoordY
data.comment: Source coordinate Y

data.name: CoordUnits
data.comment: 1 = length (meters or feet), 2 = seconds of arc (lat/long)

data.name: NumSamp
data.comment: Number of samples in this trace

data.name: SampRate
data.comment: Sample interval for this trace
Sample size depends on the Format Code: 1 = 4 bytes (IBM float) 2 = 2 bytes (big-endian integer) 3 = 4 bytes (big-endian integer) 4 = 4 bytes (special format integer with gain)
